questions.question_text: If the diagonals of a parallelogram are equal, then show that it is a rectangle.
hints: Use properties of parallelogram and triangle congruence.
Consider triangles formed by diagonals.

questions.question_text: Show that the diagonals of a square are equal and bisect each other at right angles.
hints: Use properties of square and parallelogram.
Apply congruence of triangles.

questions.question_text: Diagonal AC of a parallelogram ABCD bisects ∠ A (see Fig. 8.11). Show that (i) it bisects ∠ C also, (ii) ABCD is a rhombus.
hints: Use alternate interior angles and properties of parallelogram.
Prove all sides equal using triangle congruence.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a rectangle in which diagonal AC bisects ∠ A as well as ∠ C. Show that: (i) ABCD is a square (ii) diagonal BD bisects ∠ B as well as ∠ D.
hints: Use angle sum property and properties of rectangle.
Prove all sides equal.

questions.question_text: In parallelogram ABCD, two points P and Q are taken on diagonal BD such that DP = BQ (see Fig. 8.12). Show that: (i) ∆ APD ≅ ∆ CQB (ii) AP = CQ (iii) ∆ AQB ≅ ∆ CPD (iv) AQ = CP (v) APCQ is a parallelogram
hints: Use properties of parallelogram and triangle congruence (SAS, ASA).
Prove opposite sides equal and parallel.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a parallelogram and AP and CQ are perpendiculars from vertices A and C on diagonal BD (see Fig. 8.13). Show that (i) ∆ APB ≅ ∆ CQD (ii) AP = CQ
hints: Use properties of parallelogram and AAS congruence.
Consider alternate interior angles.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a trapezium in which AB || CD and AD = BC (see Fig. 8.14). Show that (i) ∠ A = ∠ B (ii) ∠ C = ∠ D (iii) ∆ ABC ≅ ∆ BAD (iv) diagonal AC = diagonal BD [Hint : Extend AB and draw a line through C parallel to DA intersecting AB produced at E.]
hints: Extend AB and construct CE parallel to AD.
Use properties of isosceles triangle and parallelogram.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a quadrilateral in which P, Q, R and S are mid-points of the sides AB, BC, CD and DA (see Fig 8.20). AC is a diagonal. Show that : (i) SR || AC and SR = 1/2 AC (ii) PQ = SR (iii) PQRS is a parallelogram.
hints: Use mid-point theorem for triangles.
Prove opposite sides equal and parallel.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a rhombus and P, Q, R and S are the mid-points of the sides AB, BC, CD and DA respectively. Show that the quadrilateral PQRS is a rectangle.
hints: Use properties of rhombus and mid-point theorem.
Prove angles are 90° using diagonals.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a rectangle and P, Q, R and S are mid-points of the sides AB, BC, CD and DA respectively. Show that the quadrilateral PQRS is a rhombus.
hints: Use properties of rectangle and mid-point theorem.
Prove all sides equal using triangle congruence.

questions.question_text: ABCD is a trapezium in which AB || DC, BD is a diagonal and E is the mid-point of AD. A line is drawn through E parallel to AB intersecting BC at F (see Fig. 8.21). Show that F is the mid-point of BC.
hints: Use converse of mid-point theorem.
Consider triangle BCD and parallel lines.

questions.question_text: In a parallelogram ABCD, E and F are the mid-points of sides AB and CD respectively (see Fig. 8.22). Show that the line segments AF and EC trisect the diagonal BD.
hints: Use properties of parallelogram and mid-point theorem.
Prove equal intercepts using triangle congruence.

questions.question_text: ABC is a triangle right angled at C. A line through the mid-point M of hypotenuse AB and parallel to BC intersects AC at D. Show that (i) D is the mid-point of AC (ii) MD ⊥ AC (iii) CM = MA = 1/2 AB
hints: Use mid-point theorem and properties of right triangle.
Prove perpendicularity using parallel lines.
